com.tinmegali.security.mcipher

Class MKeyWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinmegali.security.mcipher.MKeyWrapper

  • public class MKeyWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to handle the encryption/decryption and the storage/load of keys used in encryption and decryption operation for large chunks of data in SDK previous to 23.

    • Constructor Summary

      MKeyWrapper()

      • wrapAndStoreKey

        protected void wrapAndStoreKey(android.content.Context context,
                               javax.crypto.SecretKey keyToWrap,
                               java.security.Key keyToWrapWith,
                               java.lang.String alias)
                        throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                               javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                               java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                               javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                               java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                               java.security.KeyStoreException,
                               java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                               java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Wraps and stores a SecretKey. The 'keyToWrap' is encrypted using the 'keyToWrapWith' and than saved in the Shared Preferences.
        Parameters:
        context - current Context.
        keyToWrap - SecretKey to wrap.
        keyToWrapWith - PublicKey to
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        wrapKey(Key, Key), storeKey(Context, String, String)

      • storeKey

        protected void storeKey(android.content.Context context,
                        java.lang.String wrappedKey,
                        java.lang.String alias)
        Store a encrypted secret key ('wrappedKey') in the Shared Preferences.
        Parameters:
        context - current Context.
        wrappedKey - encrypted Bouncy Castle secret key.
        See Also:
        wrapAndStoreKey(Context, SecretKey, Key, String), MCipherConstants.PREFS_NAME, MCipherConstants.WRAPPED_KEY

      • wrapKey

        protected byte[] wrapKey(java.security.Key keyToWrap,
                         java.security.Key keyToWrapWith)
                  throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                         javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                         java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Encrypts a Key using a Cipher set with Cipher.WRAP_MODE and using as Key the 'keyToWrapWith'.
        Parameters:
        keyToWrap - key to encrypt ('wrap')
        keyToWrapWith - key to be used by tge Cipher.
        Returns:
        a encoded String of the encrypted key.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        wrapAndStoreKey(Context, SecretKey, Key, String)

      • loadWrappedLargeKey

        protected javax.crypto.SecretKey loadWrappedLargeKey(android.content.Context context,
                                                     java.security.Key wrapperKey,
                                                     java.lang.String alias)
                                              throws java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                                     java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                     java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                     java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                     java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                                     java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                     javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                     MKeyWrapperException,
                                                     java.io.IOException,
                                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads from Shared Preferences a SecretKey that was already 'wrapped' and 'stored' with method wrapAndStoreKey(Context, SecretKey, Key, String). If the key isn't found, throws a MKeyWrapperException.
        Parameters:
        context - current Context.
        wrapperKey - the Key to be used in the decryption.
        Returns:
        the saved key.
        Throws:
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        MKeyWrapperException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        See Also:
        unWrapKey(byte[], Key)

      • unWrapKey

        protected java.security.Key unWrapKey(byte[] wrappedObj,
                                      java.security.Key keyToUnWrap)
                               throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                      java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                      java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Unwraps (decrypts) an encrypted Key.
        Parameters:
        wrappedObj - the encrypted key.
        keyToUnWrap - the Key responsible to decrypt the key.
        Returns:
        and decrypted Key.
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        See Also:
        MCipherUtils.decode(String)
